Articles.Content:
What it says on the tin, ever since the update to the latest build, I have not played at all. Re-installs don't fix the problem, and I am running no mods.

OS is win 10 64 bit, my antivirus is just plain old avira, nothing to indicate an issue there.

build is 1.1.3.1289

crash dump

error log

output log

There is really no one thing that "causes" the crash, It simply happens randomly while sitting on the main menu, or if you attempt to start a game.

Edited August 16, 2016 by pembroke

Hi @pembroke.

The crash is occurring immediately after this.

Quote 

HandleD3DDeviceLost
  HandleD3DDeviceLost: needs reset, doing it
FullResetD3DDevice
ResetD3DDevice
dev->Reset
D3Dwindow device not lost anymore
Crash!!!

And it looks like it is being caused by an improper screen resolution.

Quote 

desktop: 1600x900 60Hz; virtual: 3200x900 at 0,0

I'm assuming you have a dual monitor setup which is unsupported, so can you please try KSP on one monitor, you may also need to delete the settings.cfg in the Kerbal Space program folder to reset KSP to 1280x720 resolution.
Have u tried to open game in administrator mode?
okay, apparently I just have to disable the second screen and desktop any time I want to play. That fixes the problem, but is a bit annoying and I didn't think it would be an issue in windowed mode
